TopicTitle: Radiators, when do you need them?

Articles.Content: I've only just started playing again after a break and the radiators confuse me. When do you need them? How many do you need?

The main case where you need them is if you have a ship that has an ISRU refinery, and/or mining drills.  Without radiators, they overheat and performance slows to a crawl.

If you're running LV-N engines on really long burns, they can get a bit warm, but these days you can generally get by without radiators.  Various patches have gone back and forth on that one-- they were more explody in the past, and needed radiators to get by.

Some mods add parts that generate lots of heat and need radiators.  Atomic Age, for example, adds some new nuclear-powered engines that will rapidly overheat and explode if you don't have plenty of radiator capacity.

If you're going to be flying very close to the sun (i.e. a lot closer than Moho), then solar heating can cook you, in which case radiators may be necessary.  If you're using them for solar heating, be sure to get the folding kind, not the static panels.  That's because the folding radiators automatically rotate to stay edge-on to the sun, so they can radiate without absorbing much.  Static panels may actually hurt you more than they help, depending on how they're oriented relative to the sun.
